comments.author: mark.finkle@gmail.com
comments.creator: mark.finkle@gmail.com
comments.text:
Manifests allow the use of osversion and appversion flags. There are situations where specifying a range of versions is desired.

I plan on using a scheme like:

osversion=2.3:2.4 
to mean "osversions between and including 2.3 and 2.4"
comments.raw_text:
Manifests allow the use of osversion and appversion flags. There are situations where specifying a range of versions is desired.

I plan on using a scheme like:

osversion=2.3:2.4 
to mean "osversions between and including 2.3 and 2.4"
See bug 676052, comment 7 of why this is needed.
comments.creator: martijn.martijn@gmail.com
comments.text: See bug 676052, comment 7 of why this is needed.
comments.author: martijn.martijn@gmail.com
benjamin@smedbergs.us
comments.creator: benjamin@smedbergs.us
comments.text: Colons are technically a valid character inside versions, so we might need a different operator, although I can't imagine anyone actually using a colon. Also per the previous discussion, we need to figure out whether the endpoints are inclusive. The most common use case will be >=N <N+1.
comments.raw_text: Colons are technically a valid character inside versions, so we might need a different operator, although I can't imagine anyone actually using a colon. Also per the previous discussion, we need to figure out whether the endpoints are inclusive. The most common use case will be >=N <N+1.
